author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: POW/MIA Recognition Day, New iPhone 17 Launch, and Demonstration in Venezuela

author: Chandra Philip
description: Police in Ontario have issued a warning after two men charged with manslaughter in separate cases have been released on bail. Police said they were issuing the public warning for Peterborough as the crimes the men are charged with occurred in that community, but that the suspects will not be living in the community. Peterborough […]
title: Ontario Police Chief Notifies Community After Homicide Suspects Released on Bail

author: Sylvia Xu
description: The decline in fertility, which began in the 1960s, coincided with societal change including rising divorce rates and legalized abortion.
title: An Impending Population Crisis? World Fertility Rate Hits 60-Year Low

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Saskatchewan Premier Scott Moe says he opposes Ottawa’s bid to limit provincial use of the notwithstanding clause, a section of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms that gives provinces the right to protect legislation from constitutional challenges under certain sections of the Charter for up to five years. Moe’s comments came in response to […]
title: Saskatchewan Says Federal Attempt to Limit Notwithstanding Clause a ‘Significant Infringement’ of Provincial Rights

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Conservative MP Garnett Genuis says society should reject not only Marxist ideology but also the “Marxist disposition,” which seeks to exploit economic difficulties and intergenerational tensions to advance a destructive revolution. Reconciliation between different segments of Canadians, along with reforming politics to serve the common good, will lead to a brighter future for the country, […]
title: Reject ‘Marxist Disposition’ of Destructive Revolution, Not Just the Philosophy, Tory MP Genuis Says

author: Mark Milke
description: Why is the Vermont democratic socialist the voice of reason while some extremist Canadian 'educators' become unhinged?
title: Bernie Sanders vs. Some Canadian Academics on Charlie Kirk’s Murder

author: Jackson Richman
description: This comes just in time for the annual UN General Assembly.
title: Senate Confirms Mike Waltz as New US Ambassador to UN

author: Tom Ozimek
description: Warplanes were scrambled after Russian MiG-31s crossed into NATO territory, prompting Estonia to trigger NATO consultations and summon Russia’s envoy.
title: NATO Intercepts 3 Russian Jets Over Estonia’s Airspace

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Proposed amendments to Canada’s Citizenship Act were debated in the House of Commons on Sept. 19, with Conservatives arguing the bill would result in an influx of citizens, while Liberals said the bill would reunify families and provide justice for “lost Canadians” who were unfairly denied citizenship. “Conservatives oppose aspects of this bill, because it […]
title: Bill C-3 Would ‘Cheapen’ Canadian Citizenship, Tories Say During House Debate

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Justice Minister Sean Fraser has tabled the government’s new hate crime legislation, which aims to add four new criminal offences to the Criminal Code. “It is disheartening when you read the news and see, day after day, stories about yet another victim suffering a hate crime at the hands of someone who is not simply […]
title: Minister of Justice Tables New Hate Crime Bill

author: Noé Chartier
description: An RCMP assistant commissioner in British Colombia has been charged with three counts of assault and has been temporarily re-assigned. The BC Prosecution Service (BCPS) announced the charges against Assistant Commissioner David Teboul on Sept. 19. BCPS said the alleged offences occurred on July 2 in Abbotsford while Teboul was off-duty. He was charged on […]
title: Top Mountie in BC Charged With Assault While Off-Duty

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Winnipeg police say they have made several arrests on the city’s transit system the same day a new initiative was introduced aimed at curbing escalating violence and disorder on public transit. The new program, dubbed the Winnipeg Transit Violent Crime Intervention Strategy, involves boosting the presence of uniformed and undercover officers at bus stops and […]
title: Winnipeg Police Make Several Arrests Following Launch of Transit Crime Prevention Strategy

author: Rachel Roberts
description: Conservative influencer Candace Owens is being sued by the Macrons for repeating claims first made in France that the First Lady was born male.
title: Brigitte Macron Will Show Scientific Evidence She Was Born a Woman in Court Case, Lawyer Says

author: Chandra Philip
description: More than 1.2 million Canadians left an emergency room last year without receiving treatment, according to a new report. Canada documented 16.3 million visits to emergency rooms in 2024, with 1,267,736—or 7.8 percent—of  patients not receiving treatment, said the report published this month by public policy think tank MEI. The highest rate of patients exiting […]
title: 1.2 Million Canadians Left ERs in 2024 Without Treatment: Report

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Nearly 20 percent of Calgary’s police officers are on leave or working in alternate positions due to physical injury or psychological distress, according to a Sept. 9 memo from the city’s police commission. The memo was presented by the Calgary Police Commission, an independent body responsible for overseeing the Calgary Police Service (CPS), to a […]
title: One in Five Calgary Police Officers on Leave or Accommodation Due to ‘Physical or Mental Injuries’: Memo

author: The Canadian Press
description: The Canada Revenue Agency says it’s hiring more staff at its call centres and expanding its use of artificial intelligence as part of a 100-day plan to improve its services. Earlier this month, Finance Minister François-Philippe Champagne set a 100-day timeline for the CRA to fix call centre delays. The CRA says it’s taking “immediate […]
title: CRA Says It’s Hiring More Call Centre Staff, Using AI to Improve Services

author: The Canadian Press
description: Canadian vehicle and auto part exports faced more than US$380 million in tariffs in July, a sharp jump from previous months as U.S. levies kicked in. A data analysis released last week by Anderson Economic Group showed US$1.1 billion in tariffs were imposed on assembled vehicles from Canada and Mexico in July, including more than […]
title: US Tariffs on Canadian Autos, Parts Jumped to US$380 Million in July: Report

author: Tom Ozimek
description: The plan accelerates a liquefied natural gas ban, lowers the oil price cap, and expands restrictions to foreign firms accused of helping Moscow.
title: EU Unveils New Russia Sanctions Package, Targets LNG and Chinese Entities

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith has directed officials to prepare legislation to invoke the Charter’s notwithstanding clause on gender laws for minors in the face of legal challenges by activists, according to a leaked government memo. The province’s justice department has asked other departments to compile information on legal implications surrounding the matter and other options […]
title: Alberta Premier Asks for Notwithstanding Clause to Override Legal Challenge on Minors’ Gender Laws: Memo

author: Alex Wu
description: 'Ten minutes after the rain stopped, dozens of children with breathing difficulties rushed into the clinic,' a local medical worker told The Epoch Times.
title: Chinese Authorities Report Sudden Outbreak of Thunderstorm Asthma in Multiple Regions

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Sanctions would freeze assets, impose arms restrictions, and curb missile development unless a last-minute deal is reached.
title: UN Security Council Rejects Iran Sanctions Relief Over Nuclear Program

author: Patrick Keeney
description: Commentary The U.S. Department of Energy’s July 29 report titled “A Critical Review of Impacts of Greenhouse Gas Emissions on the U.S. Climate” warrants careful attention. Its conclusions sharply challenge the prevailing climate orthodoxy. Written in a sober tone rather than alarmist rhetoric, the authors state that U.S. policy actions are likely to have “undetectably […]
title: Climate Prudence vs. Climate Panic: DOE’s Reality Check and Canada’s EV Retreat

author: Noé Chartier
description: The federal government has deemed band members from the Irish rap group Kneecap ineligible to enter Canada over concerns it has glorified terrorist organizations. The announcement came by way of Liberal MP Vince Gasparro on Sept. 19, who said on social media that the group has “engaged in actions and have made statements that are […]
title: Irish Band Kneecap Barred From Entering Canada for ‘Glorifying’ Terrorism: MP

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith is describing Ottawa’s bid to limit provincial use of the notwithstanding clause as a risk to “national unity.” Smith spoke out on Sept. 18 against the federal government’s asking the Supreme Court of Canada to set limits on the manner in which provinces can use the notwithstanding clause, which is part […]
title: Alberta’s Smith ‘Extremely Disappointed’ By Ottawa’s Attempt to Restrict Provincial Use of Notwithstanding Clause

author: The Canadian Press
description: Filmmaker and journalist Avi Lewis officially announced he is running for NDP leader in a video shared on social media Friday morning. Alberta NDP MP Heather McPherson is now listed as a registered leadership candidate with Elections Canada. She has not yet officially announced her intention to run and her spokesperson declined an interview request. […]
title: Avi Lewis, Heather McPherson Prepare NDP Leadership Runs

author: The Canadian Press
description: Automakers are warning they could be on the hook for billions of dollars in credit purchases if Canada’s electric vehicle mandate is enforced as written, and sales don’t ramp up. Speaking to a Parliamentary committee on Thursday, the head of the Canadian organization representing Ford, General Motors and Stellantis said automakers already have deals lined […]
title: Automakers Could Be on the Hook for Billions Under EV Mandate If Sales Don’t Ramp Up

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: A software problem affecting the display panels of more than one dozen Toyota models has prompted the company to issue a recall, citing an elevated crash risk. The Canadian recall affects 70,480 Lexus and Toyota vehicles across thirteen different models, the company said in an updated recall notice published by Transport Canada. “On certain vehicles, […]
title: Toyota Issues Recall for More Than 70,000 Vehicles in Canada, Citing Crash Risk

author: Owen Evans
description: Papua New Guinea is delaying forging closer military defense ties with Australia, as Beijing ramps up pressure on the island nation.
title: China Warns Papua New Guinea Over Defence Pact With Australia

author: The Canadian Press
description: Newly released documents show Ottawa has spent almost $1.3 billion on cloud services provided by U.S. companies, with most of the money going to Microsoft—and its uses include what it calls “mission-critical” defence applications. The information was shared in a government response to a question posed by Conservative MP Todd Doherty. He asked government departments […]
title: National Defence Using US Cloud Services for ‘Mission Critical’ Applications

author: Guy Birchall
description: The British overseas intelligence agency announced the launch of a secure dark web portal known as Secret Courier to allow people to discreetly contact them.
title: Britain’s MI6 to Use Dark Web to Find New Recruits

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The United States said it could not support the U.N. resolution because it would leave Hamas in control of Gaza.
title: US Vetoes UN Resolution Urging Immediate Cease-Fire, Hostage Release in Gaza

author: Chris Summers
description: Egypt's Interior Ministry said the bracelet was stolen by a restoration specialist and eventually sold in Cairo's jewelry district.
title: Egypt Says 3,000-Year-Old Bracelet Stolen, Melted Down, Sold for $4,000

author: Jarvis Lim
description: Analysts warn Beijing is using a combination of physical force and environmental lawfare to assert its sweeping claims against the Philippines.
title: China’s Coercive South China Sea Strategy Threatens to Destabilize Indo-Pacific: Experts

author: The Associated Press
description: ATHENS, Greece—Divers have recovered artifacts from the Titanic’s sister ship, the Britannic, for the first time since the ocean liner sank in the Aegean Sea more than a century ago after striking a mine during World War I. The Culture Ministry in Greece said Monday that an 11-member deep-sea diving team conducted a weeklong operation […]
title: Divers Recover Artifacts From the Titanic’s Sister Ship Britannic for the First Time

author: The Associated Press
description: The widow of Alexei Navalny said Wednesday that two independent labs have found that her husband was poisoned shortly before his death in a Russian prison. Navalny, who crusaded against official corruption and staged massive anti-Kremlin protests as President Vladimir Putin’s fiercest foe, died in the Arctic penal colony in February 2024. He was serving […]
title: Alexei Navalny’s Widow Says Lab Reports Show Her Husband Was Poisoned

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Medical experts say the ban will cost lives, but the Crisafulli government insists pill testing 'sends the wrong message' regarding illicit drug use.
title: Queensland Becomes 1st Australian State to Ban ‘Pill Testing’ Services

author: Alfred Bui
description: Australia’s housing push is running up against climate risks, the Housing Industry Association has warned.
title: Australia Must Build 240,000 Homes a Year, But Many Sites Face Flood or Fire Risk

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: QCoal is the latest miner moving to cut back operations in response to Queensland's high mining royalty scheme.
title: 3rd Coal Miner Threatens to Downscale Operations in Queensland, Hundreds of Jobs at Risk

author: Cindy Li
description: China’s 'Fengqiao' monitoring model was praised by former CCP leader Mao Zedong in the 1960s and has been adopted by current CCP leader Xi Jinping.
title: China Exports ‘Village Surveillance’ Model to Solomon Islands

author: Monica O’Shea
description: Premier Jacinta Allan says she wants one in five international visitors to Victoria to come from China.
title: Victoria Spends $43 Million on Campaign to Attract Chinese Tourists and Students

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The protests have been going every weekend since Oct. 7, 2023 when the war began.
title: Policing Melbourne’s Weekly Gaza Protests Has Cost $25 Million

author: PA Media
description: The Bank of England has held interest rates at 4 percent as it said the UK was “not out of the woods” on inflation, with taxes contributing to rising food costs. The Bank’s Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) voted to keep rates unchanged, following a 0.25 percentage point cut in August. Governor Andrew Bailey said: “Although […]
title: Interest Rates Held at 4 Percent as UK ‘Not Out of Woods’ on Inflation

author: PA Media
description: The UK and Irish governments are set to publish a long-awaited framework to deal with the legacy of the Northern Ireland Troubles on Friday. Irish premier Micheal Martin said a “substantive package” had been agreed which would include the restoration of civil cases. The Labour Government came to power with a pledge to replace and […]
title: UK and Irish Governments to Publish Framework on Dealing With Legacy of Troubles

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: An ambush by masked men armed with machetes and other bladed weapons left a 12- and 15-year-old dead.
title: 7 Arrested After Horrific Machete Attack on 2 Young Boys

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Conservative students feel under pressure at an Australian university, with one councillor saying he was called a ‘Nazi’ during a student meeting.
title: Motion Condemning Political Violence Voted Down at Student Union

author: Matthew Horwood, Paul Rowan Brian
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney and Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum have signed a broad strategic partnership agreement between the two countries. The deal, signed Sept. 18, will entail expanded ocean trade routes, enhanced security cooperation, and provision of more short-term work visas for Mexicans to work in Canada, along with increased ties in energy, finance, and […]
title: Canada and Mexico Sign Strategic Partnership Agreement on Trade and Security

author: PA Media
description: Two teenagers accused of carrying out a “serious, extensive, sustained and highly sophisticated” cyber attack on Transport for London (TfL) have appeared in court. Thalha Jubair, 19, and Owen Flowers, 18, were both arrested on Tuesday as part of an investigation by the National Crime Agency (NCA) and City of London Police. At Westminster Magistrates’ […]
title: Two Teenagers in Court Charged Over TFL Cyber Attack

author: PA Media
description: Britons will enjoy a burst of summery heat on Friday before conditions deteriorate sharply over the weekend, forecasters have said. Temperatures in London and the South East could climb to 27C, around 8C above the seasonal average, according to the Met Office. Meteorologist Tom Morgan described the conditions as “very topsy-turvy” with a sharp drop […]
title: UK to Bask in Late Summer Sun Before Heavy Rain and Floods Risk

author: PA Media
description: An Eritrean man is set to be deported to France on Friday after losing a High Court bid to have his removal under the Government’s “one in, one out” scheme temporarily blocked. The migrant, who cannot be named, arrived in the UK on a small boat last month and brought a claim against the Home […]
title: Migrant Set to Be Deported After Losing ‘One In, One Out’ Removal Challenge

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: With housing stretched and services under strain, consensus is emerging that measured migration could be the future.
title: Can We Grow Without Fracturing? Australia’s Migration Test
